title: yet another (random?) bootstrap ICE

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-bootstrap
labels.description: Relevant to the bootstrap subteam: Rust's build system (x.py and src/bootstrap)

body:
Switched from f9a3086363f to b52522ade1f and ran `x.py build` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', /home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/src/librustc_serialize/leb128.rs:32:28 ```
Backtrace

``` Compiling rustc-std-workspace-core v1.99.0 (/home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/src/tools/rustc-std-workspace-core) Compiling compiler_builtins v0.1.32 thread 'rustc' panicked at 'index out of bounds: the len is 0 but the index is 0', /home/matthias/vcs/github/rust/src/librustc_serialize/leb128.rs:32:28 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7f10d0070db0 -
